subject: RE: [junit] *.dll library in wrong "user.dir"
msgSnippet: Setting the user.dir in a *.bat doesn t seem to have any effect. set user.dir= testrun (full path has also been tried). Any other tips? Thanks Morten ...
messageBody:
Setting the user.dir in a *.bat doesn't seem to have any effect.
set user.dir="\testrun" (full path has also been tried).
Any other tips?

Thanks
Morten

> From: ??? [mailto:neilwang@...]
...
> I think the best way is calling a config.bat file before runing
> ant, you should call set method to set the user.dir variable in
> config.bat.
>
> -----原始邮件-----
> 发件人: Morten Grum, PH-Consult [mailto:mg@...]
> 发送时间: 2004年1月9日 4:59
> 收件人: JunitList
> 主题: [junit] *.dll library in wrong "user.dir"
>
>
> Hi All
>
> When running junit via ant I set the user dir using
> <sysproperty key=="user.dir" value=="${testrun}"/>
> in the junit task (see full task below).
>
> My java code loads a *.dll library which also needs to know the same user
> dir. However, running through ant's junit task it seems as if the *.dll is
> running in a different user dir (not having the code for the
> *.dll I haven't
> been able to detect which). When I run my java code directly from
> the promt
> there's no problem at all (the *.dll library then also knows the correct
> user directory).
>
> How could I in my tests get the *.dll library to run in the same correct
> "user.dir"?
> Any hits?
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Morten
>
> PS: my junit task looks like this:
> <target name=="test" depends=="testdirectories"
> description=="Test the distribution with JUnit" >
>
> <!-- Run tests with JUnit -->
> <junit fork=="on" dir=="${build}" showoutput=="true">
> <classpath refid=="testlibs" />
> <classpath path=="${build.testclasses}" />
> <classpath path=="${project.jar}" />
> <formatter type=="xml" />
> <jvmarg line=="-Xmx256m -Xss8192k" />
> <test name=="${testtorun}" />
> <sysproperty key=="user.dir" value=="${testrun}"/>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
>
>
>
